note_text:
OPERATIVE REPORT

INDICATION: The patient presented with mediastinal lymphadenopathy concerning for metastatic disease. 

PROCEDURE: Following the administration of moderate conscious sedation, a curvilinear array echo-bronchoscope was introduced via the oral route. A systematic ultrasonic evaluation of the mediastinum was conducted. Lymph node stations 4R (lower paratracheal) and 7 (subcarinal) were identified as enlarged and sonographically distinct. Real-time ultrasound-guided transbronchial needle aspiration (EBUS-TBNA) was performed on both stations using a 22-gauge needle to obtain diagnostic material. Hemostasis was achieved spontaneously.

note_text: PROCEDURE NARRATIVE: The patient was placed under deep sedation and intubated. Initial interrogation with the linear echo-endoscope revealed a distinct subcarinal lymph node (Station 7), which was sampled via transbronchial needle aspiration. The instrument was then exchanged for a therapeutic flexible bronchoscope. Under fluoroscopic guidance, the right middle lobe medial segment was cannulated. Transbronchial forceps biopsies were obtained from the peripheral nodular opacity. Post-procedural fluoroscopy excluded pneumothorax.

note_text: Under deep sedation, we proceeded with a combined staging and diagnostic procedure. First, the EBUS scope was used to sample the subcarinal lymph node (Station 7) to rule out N2 disease. Following this, we switched to a standard bronchoscope. We navigated to the medial segment of the Right Middle Lobe. Using fluoroscopic guidance to locate the nodule, we performed transbronchial biopsies. The patient remained stable throughout.

note_text: OPERATIVE NOTE: The patient, with known left upper lobe adenocarcinoma, underwent systematic mediastinal staging via endobronchial ultrasound. Under general anesthesia, the following nodal stations were identified and sampled via fine needle aspiration: Right Upper Paratracheal (2R), Right Lower Paratracheal (4R), Left Lower Paratracheal (4L), and Subcarinal (7). This extensive sampling (4 stations) is consistent with complete mediastinal staging guidelines.

note_text: OPERATIVE SUMMARY: This patient underwent a complex combined procedure utilizing the Ion robotic platform for peripheral navigation. We successfully navigated to the target lesion in the RLL lateral basal segment. Confirmation was achieved via radial EBUS probe (concentric view). Transbronchial biopsies were obtained. Following the robotic portion, a linear EBUS scope was introduced for mediastinal and hilar staging, sampling stations 4R, 7, and 10R.

narrative: Robot-assisted computer navigation to a peripheral RLL nodule supports add-on code 31627.

comments: Computer-assisted electromagnetic navigation to a peripheral LUL lesion supports 31627, with radial EBUS verification captured by add-on code 31654.

note_text: PROCEDURE: Electromagnetic navigational bronchoscopy was performed utilizing the Illumisite platform. The target lesion in the LUL apicoposterior segment was localized. Radial EBUS confirmed an eccentric view. Diagnostic transbronchial biopsies were performed. Subsequently, to facilitate Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy (SBRT), three gold fiducial markers were deployed in and around the tumor volume under fluoroscopic guidance.

rows.description: Bronchoscopy; with bronchoalveolar lavage

narrative: Diagnostic flexible bronchoscopy was performed for nonresolving pneumonia with bronchoalveolar lavage of a single lobe and no additional biopsies or EBUS, which is appropriately captured by 31624 alone.

coding_review.note_summary: Moderate sedation flexible bronchoscopy with diagnostic bronchoalveolar lavage of the right lower lobe for nonresolving pneumonia; no biopsies, navigation, or EBUS.
comments: Bronchoalveolar lavage performed in a single lobe without additional biopsy or EBUS supports 31624 as the sole bronchoscopy code.
Diagnostic bronchoscopy (31622) is inherent to 31624 and appropriately not billed separately.

note_text: Diagnostic lavage. We navigated to the right lower lobe and performed a washout of the alveolar space. The effluent was harvested for microbiological testing.

Ind: Recurrent pleural effusion.
Proc: US-guided PleurX insertion.
Site: Left hemithorax.
Action: Seldinger technique, tunneled, cuff buried.
Output: 1.5L.
Code: 32550.

cpt_summary.rationale: Ultrasound-guided insertion of tunneled pleural catheter (PleurX).

rows.description: Insertion of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff

narrative: A tunneled indwelling pleural catheter with cuff was inserted under ultrasound guidance for recurrent hepatic hydrothorax without pleurodesis, which is accurately captured by 32550 as a standalone pleural procedure.

coding_review.note_summary: Moderate sedation ultrasound-guided insertion of a tunneled indwelling pleural catheter for recurrent left pleural effusion from hepatic hydrothorax; no pleurodesis performed.
comments: Ultrasound-guided placement of a tunneled pleural catheter with cuff for recurrent effusion is accurately coded with 32550.
No thoracentesis, thoracoscopy, or pleurodesis is documented beyond the IPC insertion, so no additional pleural CPT codes are assigned.

note_text: OPERATIVE NOTE: The patient presented for management of refractory hepatic hydrothorax. Under ultrasound guidance, a tunneled indwelling pleural catheter was inserted into the left pleural space. The subcutaneous tunnel was created, the polyester cuff positioned appropriately, and the catheter was secured. Spontaneous drainage was observed.

note_text:
Procedure: IPC Placement
1. US check: Fluid yes.
2. Lidocaine.
3. Needle, wire, tunnel.
4. Pull catheter through tunnel.
5. Insert into chest.
6. Drain fluid.
7. Stitch up.
